author: FE Online
title: Mann Ki Baat LIVE updates: PM Narendra Modi hails ISRO's success, ballistic missile test
text:
The Prime Minister had congratulated the veterans who were honoured by gallantry awards during Republic Day celebrations on January 26. (Source: PTI) Prime Minister Narendra Modi is addressing the nation in 29th edition of his monthly radio programme ‘Mann ki Baat’. In his last January 29, PM had urged students preparing for exams to ‘smile more and score more’. The Prime Minister had congratulated the veterans who were honoured by gallantry awards during Republic Day celebrations on January 26.
Due to ongoing pollin in Uttar Pradesh, the Center had to take permission from Election Commission to air PM’s broadcast. Therefore, it is expected that the PM will not touch upon any issue which might have political connotation to it. The broadcast will begin at 11 am and will be broadcast by All India Radio, Doordarshan and on the prime minister’s official website:
Here are the live updates
11.30 am: ‘Beti Bachao, Beti Padhao’ movement is moving forward with rapid strides. It has now become a campaign of public education: PM MannKiBaat
11.29 am: The whole world celebrates 8th March as Women’s Day. In India, more importance needs to be given to our daughters: PM MannKiBaat
11.29 am: Women players are bringing glory to the nation. Congrats to women players won silver at Asian Rugby Sevens Trophy: PM MannKiBaat
11.29 am: Our Divyang brothers and sisters are capable, strongly determined, courageous and possess tremendous resolve: PM @narendramodi #MannKiBaat
11.28 am: PM @narendramodi appreciates Indian team for winning the Blind T-20 World Cup
11.27 am: PM @narendramodi appreciates Doordarshan for broadcasting a special programme of ‘Swachchhta Samachar’
11.27 am: Government, society, institutions, organizations, in fact everyone, is making some or the other effort towards Swachhta: PM #MannKiBaat
11.26 am: The hard work of the farmers has resulted in a record production of more than 2,700 lakh tonnes food grains: PM @narendramodi #MannKiBaat
11.25 am: Economic prowess of villages imparts momentum to the nation’s economic progress: PM @narendramodi #MannKiBaat
11.24 am: Agriculture makes a major contribution to the fundamentals of our country’s economy: PM @narendramodi #MannKiBaat
11.23 am: Remembering him, one teach at least 125 persons about downloading BHIM App & procedure of making transactions through it: PM #MannKiBaat
11.24 am: This scheme will complete its 100 days on 14th April, the birth anniversary of Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar: PM @narendramodi
11.23 am: Remembering Dr Ambedkar, one teaches at least 125 persons about downloading BHIM App & procedure of making transactions through it: PM
11.18 am: Hard work of farmers has resulted in a record production of more than 2,700 lakh tonnes food grains: PM Narendra Modi #MannKiBaat
11.13 am: India has successfully tested Ballistic Interceptor Missile; This is a cutting edge technology in the arena of security: PM
11.09 am: This cost effective, efficient space programme of ISRO has become a marvel for the entire world: PM Modi #MannKiBaat
11.08 am: India created history by becoming the first country to launch successfully 104 satellites into space at one go: PM Modi
11.05 am: After the successful mission of sending Mangalyaan to Mars, recently ISRO achieved a world record in the arena of space: PM Modi #MannKiBaat
11.10 am: Winter is on its way out; Vasant, the season of spring has just started to step into our lives: PM Narendra Modi #MannKiBaat
11:00 am: PM Narendra Modi’s radio broadcast begins
